definition: to clean the floor/(Internet slang) (lit.) to wash (the blood) off the floor/(fig.) to cover up evidence of sb's wrongdoing/to defend (a wrongdoer)/(coll.) to carpet-bomb
to wash/to bathe/to develop (photo)
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: High quality nylon abrasive cleaning brush set, save cost wearing parts.
sentences.chinese: 高品质尼龙耐磨洗地刷盘，节省易损件成本。

sentences.english: What is the way out? I bought an accum home, and decreased the frequency of mopping floor by water.
sentences.chinese: 我买了个吸尘器，降低了用水洗地板的频率。

definition: to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
keyboard warrior
(lit.) to splash dirty water/(fig.) to throw mud at/to smear (sb)
(neologism) person who posts online in support of the Chinese government, but unlike a wumao 五毛[wu3 mao2], is not paid for doing so (abbr. for 自帶乾糧的五毛|自带干粮的五毛[zi4 dai4 gan1 liang2 de5 wu3 mao2])
(Internet slang) to shift the blame/to pass the buck
fifty cents party (person supposed to relay government propaganda on Internet sites)
public intellectual (sometimes used derogatorily)/abbr. for 公共知識分子|公共知识分子[gong1 gong4 zhi1 shi5 fen4 zi3]
to denounce/to condemn
(Internet slang) sanctimonious bitch
"Internet Navy"/paid Internet posters/astroturfers
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
dirty water/sewage
to start a rumor
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to confuse right and wrong (idiom)
